title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The sleep-debt-tracker repository is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and manage their sleep debt. It aims to provide a simple and intuitive interface for logging sleep data and visualizing sleep patterns, ultimately promoting better sleep hygiene and understanding. The project serves as a practical application of TypeScript and web development principles.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard implementation built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example and template for creating data-rich web applications with Next.js, focusing on clean architecture, responsive design, and dynamic data visualization.

title: next-voting
description: next-voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a platform for creating and participating in polls or voting systems. This repository contains the source code for the application, focusing on providing a user-friendly and efficient voting experience.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project utilizing TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Express.js, and Vite.js to create a web application leveraging the Gemini API. This repository serves as a practical example and exploration of building modern web applications with these technologies, demonstrating integration with AI models.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository houses a collection of finance-related projects implemented using Python and Jupyter Notebooks. It explores various financial concepts and methodologies through practical code examples, serving as a resource for learning and applying Python to real-world financial problems. The projects cover a range of topics, offering insights into financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume source code, written in TeX, allowing for easy customization and generation of professional-looking resumes. It serves as a project showcasing document formatting skills and provides a template for creating and maintaining a dynamic, version-controlled resume.

This project, built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, represents a practical application and exploration of web development concepts. It serves as a focused implementation within the broader "project" topic, showcasing the integration of front-end technologies for a specific purpose. The repository provides a tangible example of how these languages can be combined to create a functional web application.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This project facilitates real-time monitoring, control, and data analysis of robotic systems and environments, serving as a central hub for Robofleet-related information.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a web-based project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository encompasses the entire project's codebase, focusing on [mention specific purpose of the project if known, otherwise use a general term].

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive and insightful map visualizations. This repository contains code and resources for displaying geographical data in a user-friendly and informative manner, exploring various techniques to represent spatial information effectively.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript for brainstorming and organizing project ideas. This repository provides a visual and collaborative platform to capture, refine, and prioritize ideas, making it a useful tool for project planning and development.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, designed to interact with a PostgreSQL database. This project showcases a practical implementation of web development principles using HTML, CSS, and Python, incorporating project structure and database management techniques. It serves as a learning resource for developers interested in building web applications with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, leveraging Supabase for backend functionality and Tailwind CSS for styling. This repository provides a framework for building an IoT asset tracking application, incorporating modern web development practices and technologies for efficient data management and a responsive user interface. The project demonstrates the integration of these technologies for a practical use case.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML-based project designed to create a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. This repository showcases a practical implementation of front-end technologies for displaying and managing event schedules, offering a flexible solution for integrating dynamic event listings into web applications. The core focus is on providing a user-friendly interface for browsing and interacting with events.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: `ros-log-viewer` is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripts, this project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and understand ROS log data, making it easier to debug and monitor ROS-based robotic systems. This repository is dedicated to the development and maintenance of this project.
